intro: Cleretum muirii, commonly known as the Muir's cleretum, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh, arid conditions of its native habitat. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit and the ability to store water in its leaves, which aids in survival in its environment. Cleretum muirii is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
